content: Which famous British playwright penned the tragedy 'Macbeth', often referred to as 'The Scottish Play' due to superstitions among actors?

Ah, you're referring to one of the most renowned playwrights in history, William Shakespeare. He penned the tragedy 'Macbeth', which is indeed often called 'The Scottish Play' by actors due to superstitions surrounding it. It's fascinating how certain works of literature can become so ingrained in our culture that they develop their own folklore and traditions.
